Message.Title: Read it and Weep
Message.Msg: Despite the current stock market rally, legendary investor Jim Rogers say the U.S economy is poised for a major crash and is warning investors to protect themselves immediately. In a riveting interview on Fox Business, Rogers warned Americans not to trust any of the positive economic news coming from world governments. "I don't trust the data from any government, including the U.S., Rogers said. "We know that governments lie to us. Everybody's printing money, but it cannot go on. This is all artificial." Rogers, who for years has been an outspoken critic of the Feds policies of "Quantitative Easing" says all the money printing is creating false hope that we are in the middle of some kind of super bull market. But in reality, he says, "we're living in a fool's paradise."
I may be an idiot? But, I am not the one posting about a crash while the markets have raced upwards 3,000 points. You sing the same song day after day. It is time to change the station...

Message.Title: I think IBM will acquire SPLK....
Message.Msg: This was rumored in early January, and I think it makes perfect sense for IBM to acquire SPLK, the first mover and leader in big data. The synergies work well. Any comments?

Topic.Title: I think IBM will acquire SPLK....

Message.Msg: SPLK has a market cap of $3.5 billion, and IBM would need to pay $5 billion to acquire them. I do not think IBM will spend $5 billion on a firm that is currently generating LESS than $200 million in revenues.
The gap at $196,08 will fill. If it trades to $190, that would be a good buy opportunity.

Topic.Title: Obama: No Growth, No Jobs, Huge Deficits, Govt. Gridlock

Message.Msg: If Bill Clinton were president, they would have a deal by now. Clinton worked with the GOP to find solutions. Obama only tries to dominate the GOP with an ideology that is far, far to the left of Bill Clintons.
